tables.name: SynapseBuiltinSqlPoolRequestsEnded

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation associated with log record.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The category of the log.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: A GUID used to group together a set of related events.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: The total elapsed time in milliseconds.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: The status of the request.

columns.name: ErrorCode
columns.description: The error/success code

columns.name: Identity
columns.description: A JSON blob that describes the identity of the user or application that performed the operation.

columns.name: Properties
columns.description: extended properties related to this event.

columns.name: LogicalServerName
columns.description: Logical server name.

columns.name: ResourceGroup
columns.description: Resource group of the SQL resoruce.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the log was generated.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The category of the log.

columns.name: AuditSchemaVersion
columns.description: The audit logs schema version.

columns.name: EventTime
columns.description: The time (UTC) the event was fired at.

columns.name: SequenceNumber
columns.description: Tracks the sequence of records within a single audit record that was too large to fit in the write buffer for audits.

columns.name: ActionId
columns.description: ID of the audit action.

columns.name: ActionName
columns.description: The name of the audit action.

columns.name: Succeeded
columns.description: Indicates whether the action that triggered the event succeeded. Is not nullable. For all events other than login events, this only reports whether the permission check succeeded or failed, not the operation.

columns.name: IsColumnPermission
columns.description: Flag indicating if this is a column level permission.

columns.name: SessionId
columns.description: ID of the session on which the event occurred.

columns.name: ServerPrincipalId
columns.description: ID of the login context that the action is performed in.

columns.name: DatabasePrincipalId
columns.description: ID of the database user context that the action is performed in.

columns.name: TargetServerPrincipalId
columns.description: Server principal that the GRANT/DENY/REVOKE operation is performed on.

columns.name: TargetDatabasePrincipalId
columns.description: The database principal the GRANT/DENY/REVOKE operation is performed on.

columns.name: ObjectId
columns.description: The ID of the entity on which the audit occurred.

columns.name: UserDefinedEventId
columns.description: User defined event id passed as an argument to sp_audit_write.

columns.name: TransactionId
columns.description: Unique identifier to identify multiple audit events in one transaction.

columns.name: ClassType
columns.description: The type of auditable entity that the audit occurs on.

columns.name: ClassTypeDescription
columns.description: The description of the class type.

columns.name: SecurableClassType
columns.description: The type of auditable entity that the audit occurs on.

columns.name: DurationMs
columns.description: Query execution duration in milliseconds.

columns.name: ResponseRows
columns.description: Number of rows returned in the result set.

columns.name: AffectedRows
columns.description: Number of rows affected by the executed statement.

columns.name: ClientTlsVersion
columns.description: Client TLS version

columns.name: ClientIp
columns.description: Source IP of the client application

columns.name: PermissionBitmask
columns.description: In some actions, this is the permissions that were grant, denied, or revoked.

columns.name: SequenceGroupId
columns.description: Unique identifier.

columns.name: SessionServerPrincipalName
columns.description: Server principal for session. Is nullable. Returns the identity of the original login which was connected to the instance of SQL Server in case there were explicit or implicit context switches.

columns.name: ServerPrincipalName
columns.description: Current login. Is nullable.

columns.name: ServerPrincipalSid
columns.description: Current login SID.

columns.name: DatabasePrincipalName
columns.description: Current user.

columns.name: TargetServerPrincipalName
columns.description: Target login of action.

columns.name: TargetServerPrincipalSid
columns.description: SID of target login.

columns.name: TargetDatabasePrincipalName
columns.description: Target user of action.

columns.name: DatabaseName
columns.description: The database context in which the action occurred.

columns.name: SchemaName
columns.description: The schema context in which the action occurred.

columns.name: ObjectName
columns.description: The name of the entity on which the audit occurred.

columns.name: Statement
columns.description: TSQL statement if it exists.

columns.name: AdditionalInformation
columns.description: Unique information that only applies to a single event is returned as XML.

columns.name: UserDefinedInformation
columns.description: Used to record any extra information the user wants to record in audit log by using the sp_audit_write stored procedure.

columns.name: ApplicationName
columns.description: Name of client application which executed the statement that caused the audit event.

columns.name: ConnectionId
columns.description: ID of the connection in the server.

columns.name: DataSensitivityInformation
columns.description: Information types and sensitivity labels returned by the audited query, based on the classified columns in the database.

columns.name: HostName
columns.description: The host name.

columns.name: SessionContext
columns.description: The Session context key value content. provided as an XML.

columns.name: IsServerLevelAudit
columns.description: Boolean indicating whether this was generated from a server level audit or database level audit.

columns.name: EventId
columns.description: unique Guid identifying each audit event.
